intro: Adenosma malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar adenosma, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Adenosma malabarica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
